ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.Inventory.Trinket.Pictures

Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.Elastic.ElasticStorable
      • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.Inventory.Trinket.Pictures.Picture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable

    public class Picture
extends ElasticStorable
implements Observable
    A class representing a compressed picture. Pictures can optionally be attached to a Trinket to show what it looks like to other users. Pictures can be added to a Trinket from either the phone's camera or gallery. These sources will provide images as uncompressed JPEGs, but the Trinket Trader app requires the images be 65535 bytes in size or less. Thus, the attached images need ot be compressed.

                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        PackageManager.NameNotFoundException

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        If hasChanged() returns true, calls the update() method for every observer in the list of observers using null as the argument. Afterwards, calls clearChanged().

        Equivalent to calling notifyObservers(null).

        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface Observable

      • delete

        public void delete()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes information related to the picture from the device's memory and from the elasticsearch server. This method should be used if you want to permanently delete a picture. Note that, as only a copy of the image is stored in the applications' folder, the original image should still exist outside of the app.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getBitmap

        public Bitmap getBitmap()
        Returns a bitmap representation of the picture. This should be used anytime the image needs to be displayed. Note that a dummy bitmap will be generated if the image is not yet loaded.
        Returns:
        bitmap representation of the picture

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns the tag section of the elastic search entry's URL. Trades, photos, and users are all saved separately in elastic search within their own tags. This method will return "User" as the tag for User objects, "Trade" for Trade objects, and "picture" for Picture objects.
        Specified by:
        getTag in class ElasticStorable
        Returns:
        String - the tag used to generate the url for each type of item stored in elastic search

      • getResourceUrl

        public java.lang.String getResourceUrl()
        Returns the base URL each class of ElasticStorable object will be saved to. Trades, photos, and users are all saved separately in elastic search within their own tags. Each individual object is then stored with their own unique ids. The resource URL specifies the base URL which is composed of the server URL ("http://cmput301.softwareprocess.es:8080/cmput301f15t01/") followed by the tag of the particular class, "User" as the tag for User objects, "Trade" for Trade objects, and "picture" for Picture objects.
        Specified by:
        getResourceUrl in class ElasticStorable
        Returns:
        String - base URL (no unique ID) for an object being stored to elastic search

      • getUid

        public java.lang.String getUid()
        Returns a unique ID for each user's objects being stored to Elastic Search. This is appended to the resource url to save each object to the elastic search server. For a particular user of the system associated with a unique email address, this method will always return the same UID.
        Specified by:
        getUid in class ElasticStorable
        Returns:
        - an id unique to each user of the system for saving objects to elastic search

      • getSearchUrl

        public java.lang.String getSearchUrl()
        Returns the base URL each class of ElasticStorable object can be searched on the server with. Trades, photos, and users are all saved separately in elastic search within their own tags. Each individual object is then stored with their own unique ids. The search URL specifies the base URL which is composed of the server URL ("http://cmput301.softwareprocess.es:8080/cmput301f15t01/") followed by the tag of the particular class, "User" as the tag for User objects, "Trade" for Trade objects, and "picture" for Picture objects, and then followed by "/_search/".
        Specified by:
        getSearchUrl in class ElasticStorable
        Returns:
        String - url for searching a class of objects on elastic search
